snippet: The sale could bolster other parts of the financially struggling university, but it could also mean the end of WHUT, the 35-year-old public television station that is the first owned and operated by a historically black institution.
abstract: Howard University is expected to announce decision on whether it will try to sell rights to spectrum on which it broadcasts Howard University Television at Federal Communications Commission auction; university has struggled financially, and sale could lead to influx of hundreds of millions of dollars, but sale would mean end of station WHUT, which remains only black-owned public station in country.
lead_paragraph: The sale could bolster other parts of the financially struggling university, but it could also mean the end of WHUT, the 35-year-old public television station that is the first owned and operated by a historically black institution.

headline.main: Howard University May Sell Rights to Its Public TV Station’s Spectrum
headline.print_headline: A Distinct Voice, a Shaky Future
